title: Vintage Fishing Lures & Tackle
description: Cast your memory back to classic fishing tackle! How much do you know about vintage lures and gear?

questions.question: Which famous lure company, founded in 1898 in Dowagiac, Michigan, is considered the first to commercially produce wooden fishing lures?
What type of classic topwater lure mimicked a wounded minnow on the surface and was wildly popular in the 1950s?
Which company made the iconic 'Hula Popper,' a topwater lure with a rubber skirt that created a popping action?
What material were most classic fishing lures carved from before plastic became common?
Which type of fishing reel, featuring a revolving spool, was the standard for baitcasting in the mid-20th century?
What was the common problem baitcasting reel users experienced when the spool spun faster than the line could come off?
Which push-button reel, introduced by Zebco in 1949, made fishing easier for beginners and became an American classic?
What old-time bait did anglers dig up from their yards or buy at bait shops for panfish and trout?
Which brand of fishing tackle box, with its tiered fold-out trays, was found in nearly every angler's garage?
options: All of the above were popular

questions.question: What classic metal lure, shaped like a spoon, has been catching fish since the 1800s by wobbling and flashing in the water?
Which Finnish-made balsa wood minnow lure became one of the best-selling fishing lures in the world?
What was a 'stringer' used for when fishing?
options: Keeping caught fish alive in the water
Tying the boat to the dock

questions.question: Which bamboo rod, carefully crafted from split cane, was considered the finest type of fly fishing rod?
